page.title: 05Screel Hill 1
page.content: In the afternoon of our visit to the Gelston area we attempted to climb Screel Hill. We left our bags at the small car park made by the forestry. We followed a forestry track for a short while. This was uncomfortable as it was covered with loose granite stones. (This is the stone from which Screel is formed). We turned off the track to follow a forest trail. This was a path through the forest which was marked by nothing but posts and the occasional tree with a yellow band round it. These trails were created by the Forestry Commission recently to attract the public to the forests. As it was very hot we were glad to get into the shade of the trees. We noticed that the trees nearer the bottom of Screel were Scots pine, whereas further up the hill other
